Live from NPR News in Washington I'm shape Stevens the White House is expanding the scope of the FBI proven to Brett Kavanaugh's background FBI agents can interview anyone they want about sexual misconduct claims dating back to Kevin O's days in high school and college
They interviewed at least four people so far and have until the end of the week to finish their investigation meanwhile Arizona Senator Jeff flake says he would vote against Kavanaugh for the U.S Supreme Court if an FBI probe shows he lied under oath and New Hampshire Public Radio's Lauren children has more on flakes comments yesterday
Senator Flake helped force and expanded FBI investigation that assault allegations against Kavanaugh in New Hampshire Monday flake said that does the Asian should only stick to what he calls current and credible allegations like from Dr Christine Blasey Ford
Evidence comes back and forth story then that's why we're doing the show that I have an open mind on his water every
Since he was in New Hampshire flake was also asked about running for president but he says there's too much going on in Washington right now to think about that for NPR News I'm Lauren children in Manchester New Hampshire
A ground gathered in Las Vegas last night to recognize the anniversary of the mass shooting in an open air concert survivors victims' families and others were in a downtown memorial garden that was created by volunteers miles away from the attack site
Meanwhile hundreds of survivors of mass shooting formed human train around the side of the country music festival where the gunman opened fire fifty eight people and the gunman died in the attack in more than four hundred others were wounded last month a share for Clark County declared to police investigation had been concluded
Aftershocks are continuing in Indonesia four days after an earthquake and tsunami devastated parts to sue the waste the island aid workers are still finding bodies of disaster victims including the remains of thirty students inside a church that was covered in debris
The BBC's Rebecca ... reports that food and water running short and the capital city of ...

A convoy add some the central government bringing aid but ... is hands people here are being incredibly patient sitting under these tents in very hot weather

Following mixed trading on Wall street you're listening to NPR News
Testimony in the murder trial of Chicago police officer Jason Van Dyke is expected to resume today the proceedings were cancelled yesterday because the juror was sick
And I just charged with firing sixteen shots at teenager lukewarm McDonald's for years to go defense attorneys argued that the officer acted properly macdonald did not follow orders to drop the knife
After allegedly confronting Van Dyke earlier the same night California's joining other states and cities enacting laws that allow recreational marijuana use as NPR's Kirk Siegler reports the new law requires prosecutors to reduce
Or even erase prior marijuana related convictions
The bill orders state prosecutors to examine all marijuana related cases between Nineteen Seventy five and twenty sixteen when recreational pot was legalized by voters
That ballot measure sought to decriminalize prior convictions too but until now there hasn't been a formal process to do that the state department of justice has until July of next year to compiled a list of prior convictions to determine if past criminal records can be wiped or at least some people can have their cases reduced
Criminal justice reform groups are sharing this they point out that pot related offenses disproportionally affect people of color it's estimated that close to a quarter million Californians could be affected by this new law Kirk Siegler NPR News Los Angeles
Christian broadcasting network is launching a twenty four hour news channels CEO Gordon Robertson says the new see being channel initially with Aaron ... Fifteen cities by a TV industry in other markets [noise] this is NPR News
Support for NPR comes from NPR stations other contributors include the corporation for public broadcasting and the state of John crock who's ... serves as an enduring investment in the future of public radio and the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation and R. W. J. F. dot org

It's all night jazz for Tuesday Morning in Tampa Bay we're back from the break in at the top of the four o'clock hour it's the final hour of all night jazz before we get MORNING EDITION so if you're just tuning in and you're freaking out because oh my goodness you missed all night jazz tonight
Don't worry about it we are the other nine to five here on W. USF and we bring you the best jazz music in Tampa Bay from nine pm until we hit MORNING EDITION at five every night of the week so it will be here tomorrow night nine PM come hang out with us
But in the meantime we're going to start off this four o'clock hour with our traditional bird break featuring the man himself Charlie Parker on the Alto sax on the Nineteen forty seven recording of carbon the bird
Howard McGee is going to join on trumpet or do ground the tenor sax do to Marlboros on piano Barney Kaesong guitar red calendar on base and Don Lemon on drums
We have that and more coming up in the final hour of the night here's our bird break with Charlie Parker on carbon the bird
